headline: Roomba maker iRobot files for bankruptcy, to go private after buyout
summary: Roomba vacuum cleaner maker iRobot said on Sunday that it ​had filed for bankruptcy protection, and ‌would go private after being acquired by Picea, its ‌primary manufacturer.  The company, which raised concerns about staying in business in March, filed for bankruptcy in the District of Delaware as it ⁠grapples with macroeconomic ‌and tariff-related uncertainties.  iRobot faces competition from Chinese rivals such as Ecovacs ‍Robotics, which offer advanced features at lower prices.

content.title: Roomba maker iRobot files for bankruptcy, to go private after buyout
content.summary: Roomba vacuum cleaner maker iRobot said on Sunday that it ​had filed for bankruptcy protection, and ‌would go private after being acquired by Picea, its ‌primary manufacturer.  The company, which raised concerns about staying in business in March, filed for bankruptcy in the District of Delaware as it ⁠grapples with macroeconomic ‌and tariff-related uncertainties.  iRobot faces competition from Chinese rivals such as Ecovacs ‍Robotics, which offer advanced features at lower prices.

headline: He Walked Away From A $300K Finance Salary To Start A Business. Losing $200 Sushi And Ski Trips Every Winter Was 'Absolutely Brutal'
summary: After seven years in a high-paying finance role that looked perfect on paper but made him miserable, a 30-year-old finally quit. The job paid $300,000 a year, and came with a lifestyle full of fine dining, skiing, and status. But deep down, he hated it. From Paychecks To Pressure “No dramatic blow up, no big revelation,” he wrote in a recent Reddit post on r/Entrepreneur. “Just the quiet realization that I could not keep pretending I enjoyed it.” So he left. headline: Amazon Scrapped Its Deal to Buy iRobot. Now the Roomba Maker Is Filing for Bankruptcy.
summary: iRobot  filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy and agreed to be taken over by its main supplier on Sunday, meaning that the Roomba maker will go private nearly two years after a deal with  Amazon.com  fell apart.  It owes $352 million to Picea and nearly $91 million of that debt is past due, according to iRobot.  The move caps a dramatic fall from grace for the company—iRobot’s market capitalization has plunged from a peak of $4.53 billion in January 2021 to $137.5 million at Friday’s close.

content.title: Amazon Scrapped Its Deal to Buy iRobot. Now the Roomba Maker Is Filing for Bankruptcy.
content.summary: iRobot  filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy and agreed to be taken over by its main supplier on Sunday, meaning that the Roomba maker will go private nearly two years after a deal with  Amazon.com  fell apart.  It owes $352 million to Picea and nearly $91 million of that debt is past due, according to iRobot.  The move caps a dramatic fall from grace for the company—iRobot’s market capitalization has plunged from a peak of $4.53 billion in January 2021 to $137.5 million at Friday’s close.

headline: Roomba maker iRobot files for bankruptcy protection; will be taken private under restructuring
summary: Roomba maker iRobot has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, but says that it doesn't expect any disruptions to devices as the more than 30-year-old company is taken private under a restructuring process.  IRobot, which became well known for its robotic vacuums, has struggled of late, dealing with increased competition, layoffs and a declining stock price.  In 2022 Amazon announced that it had agreed to buy iRobot for about $1.7 billion, but that deal was called off last year.

content.title: Roomba maker iRobot files for bankruptcy protection; will be taken private under restructuring
content.summary: Roomba maker iRobot has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, but says that it doesn't expect any disruptions to devices as the more than 30-year-old company is taken private under a restructuring process.  IRobot, which became well known for its robotic vacuums, has struggled of late, dealing with increased competition, layoffs and a declining stock price.  In 2022 Amazon announced that it had agreed to buy iRobot for about $1.7 billion, but that deal was called off last year.

headline: New Swiftly Consumer Survey Reveals Nearly 8 in 10 Shoppers Trust Their Local Grocer Over National Giants
summary: SEATTLE, December 15, 2025--Swiftly, a leading provider of retail technology and retail media solutions, today released its fourth annual True Cost of a Grocery Shop survey, revealing a powerful and timely advantage for independent and regional grocers: nearly 80% of shoppers say they trust their neighborhood brick-and-mortar grocery store more than national giants like Amazon or Walmart to offer fair, personalized deals.

content.title: New Swiftly Consumer Survey Reveals Nearly 8 in 10 Shoppers Trust Their Local Grocer Over National Giants
content.summary: SEATTLE, December 15, 2025--Swiftly, a leading provider of retail technology and retail media solutions, today released its fourth annual True Cost of a Grocery Shop survey, revealing a powerful and timely advantage for independent and regional grocers: nearly 80% of shoppers say they trust their neighborhood brick-and-mortar grocery store more than national giants like Amazon or Walmart to offer fair, personalized deals.

headline: Three-Quarters of Employers Improve Workplace Safety Scores Over Three Years

headline: iRobot Files for Bankruptcy After Amazon Was Forced to Scrap Its Deal to Buy the Roomba Maker
summary: iRobot  filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy and agreed to be taken over by its main supplier on Sunday,  two years after a deal with  Amazon.com  fell apart.  The Massachusetts-based consumer robotics company said in a statement that it would enter a restructuring agreement giving primary contract manufacturer Picea 100% of the equity interests in the company.  It owes $352 million to Picea and nearly $91 million of that debt is past due, according to iRobot.

content.title: iRobot Files for Bankruptcy After Amazon Was Forced to Scrap Its Deal to Buy the Roomba Maker
content.summary: iRobot  filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy and agreed to be taken over by its main supplier on Sunday,  two years after a deal with  Amazon.com  fell apart.  The Massachusetts-based consumer robotics company said in a statement that it would enter a restructuring agreement giving primary contract manufacturer Picea 100% of the equity interests in the company.  It owes $352 million to Picea and nearly $91 million of that debt is past due, according to iRobot.

headline: Oaktree-backed firm unveils $1.2 billion Amsterdam 'hyperscale' data centre project
summary: Oaktree Capital‑backed Pure Data Centres said on Monday it plans to invest up to 1 billion euros ($1.17 billion) in a new Amsterdam campus, one of Europe's largest hyperscale ​data‑centre commitments this year.  The company said the site will be leased to a single hyperscale cloud provider.  "Having a hyperscale lease makes any deal noteworthy, but I think just the scale of this deal and the location, it's in quite a constrained location in the market," Dawn Childs, CEO of Pure Data Centres told Reuters, flagging an ongoing moratorium in Amsterdam that limits new data centre projects.

content.title: Oaktree-backed firm unveils $1.2 billion Amsterdam 'hyperscale' data centre project
content.summary: Oaktree Capital‑backed Pure Data Centres said on Monday it plans to invest up to 1 billion euros ($1.17 billion) in a new Amsterdam campus, one of Europe's largest hyperscale ​data‑centre commitments this year.  The company said the site will be leased to a single hyperscale cloud provider.  "Having a hyperscale lease makes any deal noteworthy, but I think just the scale of this deal and the location, it's in quite a constrained location in the market," Dawn Childs, CEO of Pure Data Centres told Reuters, flagging an ongoing moratorium in Amsterdam that limits new data centre projects.

thumbnail.caption: Cables and computers are seen inside a data centre at an office in the heart of the financial district in London

headline: Roomba Maker iRobot Declares Bankrupty. Its Stock Is Plunging 70%
summary: Shares of iRobot plummeted Monday after the Roomba robot vacuum maker announced a Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing on Sunday.

content.title: Roomba Maker iRobot Declares Bankrupty. Its Stock Is Plunging 70%
content.summary: Shares of iRobot plummeted Monday after the Roomba robot vacuum maker announced a Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing on Sunday.

thumbnail.caption: Justin Sullivan / Getty Images With Monday's losses, iRobot shares have lost about 85% of their value in 2025.

headline: Inflation, tariffs help send iRobot into bankruptcy
summary: The Roomba-maker’s largest Chinese manufacturer has agreed to acquire the company via a Chapter 11 restructuring.

content.title: Inflation, tariffs help send iRobot into bankruptcy
content.summary: The Roomba-maker’s largest Chinese manufacturer has agreed to acquire the company via a Chapter 11 restructuring.
